Cross-Platform Environment

Using the Serena ChangeMan Version Manager desktop client, you can share configuration files, access control databases, project databases, and archives between Windows and UNIX. You can store archives on UNIX and access them from Windows, or vice versa, through project databases.

To access a project database in a cross-platform environment, you must create the project database using the Version Manager desktop client on Windows. From Windows or UNIX, you can access project databases created on Windows (whether or not they reside on UNIX or Windows); project databases created using the Version Manager desktop client on UNIX can only be accessed from UNIX.

To share archives between UNIX and Windows, you must configure project databases to translate the end-of-line (EOL) character in text files. Configure each project database so that the EOL character is translated in:

  • New archives for text files
  • Existing archives for text files

Warning! DO NOT enable EOL translation of binary files; it may corrupt the archives.
